meanings.definition: To shorten sail by taking in one or more reefs.
meanings.sent1: The sailor was reefing the sail to make it smaller.
meanings.sent2: The captain instructed the crew to start reefing the sails as the storm approached.
meanings.sent3: While reefing the sail, the sailor accidentally got tangled in the ropes.
meanings.sent4: As the wind picked up, the sailor knew it was time to start reefing the sail to stay safe.
meanings.sent5: Reefing the sail quickly became second nature to the experienced sailor.

meanings.definition: A portion of a sail rolled and tied up to reduce the area exposed to the wind.
meanings.sent1: The sailor secured the reefing to keep the sail from flapping in the wind.
meanings.sent2: During the storm, the crew quickly tied down the reefing to prevent damage to the sail.
meanings.sent3: The colorful reefing on the sail added a touch of flair to the boat.
meanings.sent4: The neatly tied reefing on the sail reminded the crew of the importance of proper sail maintenance.
meanings.sent5: The old sail had intricate reefing that showed the craftsmanship of its maker.

meanings.definition: A chain of rocks or coral lying at or near the surface of the water.
meanings.sent1: The divers explored the vibrant reefing teeming with marine life.
meanings.sent2: The boat carefully navigated around the shallow reefing to avoid running aground.
meanings.sent3: The shimmering colors of the reefing beneath the water's surface were mesmerizing.
meanings.sent4: The fragile ecosystem of the reefing required protection from human activities.
meanings.sent5: The sunlight danced on the surface of the clear water above the reefing.
